column1: #Text=South Korean President Park Geun-Hye with United States President Barack Obama .
#Text=It shows the modern , indigenous conventional military capabilities of the South Korean forces .
#Text=It was also to credibly communicate — literally show to the North — possession of an adequate deterrent force , a force that is both capable and credible .
#Text=The underlying capacity supports the newly announced bilateral tailored deterrence strategy between South Korea and the United States .

#Text=The military parade served to transparently show , in a largely passive/non-offensive/non-reactionary way , the capacity to follow through on that strategy that is directed at North Korea 's offensive nuclear weapons , offensive chemical weapons , and offensive biological weapons programs rather than a more general deterrence strategy .
#Text=There is much more to a tailored deterrence strategy , but that is one part of it .

#Text=The specific declaratory policy highlights South Korea 's responsibility to " continue to build reliable inter-operable response capabilities and to develop the Korean Air and Missile Defense system .
